TopicTitle: Cant delete this, and I solved my own issue

Articles.Content:
Solved my own issue and do not know how to delete my own posts.

Edited November 30, 2018 by Syrius
Solved my own problem

3 hours ago, Syrius said:

Solved my own issue and do not know how to delete my own posts.

You cannot delete your own post, probably because there is (usually) no point in deleting something, especially in the support sub-forums.

A forum is a place to share experience, issues, solutions and much more, so instead of deleting your own post, you may consider to keep the original post with the question/problem description and if you found a solution on your own, write it down as well. You can create a new post for it and mark it as 'best answer' so everybody knows, that this issue got solved and as soon as anybody comes around who got the some problem, this person can find the solution as well
No need to delete your posts but a moderator can lock the thread for you, which I have done.
